While Cornelius was praying, God sent a celestial messenger to him, who addressed him by name. The centurion was afraid, yet knew 
                                                                           326
that the angel was sent of God to instruct him, and said, "What is it, Lord? And he said unto him, Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God. And now send men to Joppa, and call for one Simon, whose surname is Peter. He lodgeth with one Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea side. He shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do."
